---
title: "**ANÁLISIS DE UN DBCA FACTORIAL CON ARREGLO 3x3**"
subtitle: "Estiércol y roca fosfórica en el rendimiento de Hordeum vulgare L. var Zapata en Santiago de Chuco, La Libertad"
output: pdf_document
---

`Se desea evaluar el efecto del estiércol de ovino y  roca fosfórica en el rendimiento kg/ha de Hordeum vulgare L. var Zapata (cebada).`

`Se empleo un diseño de Bloques Completos al azar con arreglo factorial 3x3 con 4 repeticiones`

| FACTOR                          | NIVEL         | CLAVE |
|---------------------------------|---------------|-------|
|                                 | 0 $t./Ha.$    | $A_1$ |
| Estiércol de ovino $t./Ha.$ (A) | 4 $t./Ha.$    | $A_2$ |
|                                 | 8 $t./Ha.$    | $A_3$ |
|                                 | 0 $Kg./Ha.$   | $B_1$ |
| Roca Fosfórica $Kg./Ha.$ (B)    | 333 $Kg./Ha.$ | $B_2$ |
|                                 | 666 $Kg./Ha.$ | $B_3$ |

: FACTORES, NIVELES Y CLAVES

| TRATAMIENTO                | CLAVE    |
|----------------------------|----------|
| 0 $t./Ha.$ x 0 $Kg./Ha.$   | $A_1B_1$ |
| 0 $t./Ha.$ x 333 $Kg./Ha$  | $A_1B_2$ |
| 0 $t./Ha.$ x 666 $Kg./Ha.$ | $A_1B_3$ |
| 4 $t./Ha.$ x 0 $Kg./Ha.$   | $A_2B_1$ |
| 4 $t./Ha.$ x 333 $Kg./Ha.$ | $A_2B_2$ |
| 4 $t./Ha.$ x 666 $Kg./Ha.$ | $A_2B_3$ |
| 8 $t./Ha.$ x 0 $kg./Ha.$   | $A_3B_1$ |
| 8 $t./Ha.$ x 333 $Kg./Ha$  | $A_3B_2$ |
| 8 $t./Ha.$ x 666 $Kg./Ha.$ | $A_3B_3$ |

: COMBINACIONES O TRATAMIENTOS

`Experimento Bifactorial 3x3, arreglo combinatorio con DBCA`

![](cuadro_datos.png "Experimento Bifactorial 3x3, arreglo combinatorio con DBCA")

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r echo=FALSE,error=FALSE}
library(carData)
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
library(MVN)
library(car)
library(agricolae)
data <- read_excel("data.xlsx",sheet = 1)
attach(data)
data1 <- read_excel("data.xlsx",sheet = 2)
data$A= as.factor(data$A)
data$B= as.factor(data$B)
data$BLOQUE= as.factor(data$BLOQUE)
data$TRATAMIENTO= as.factor(data$TRATAMIENTO)
i=length(levels(data$A))
j=length(levels(data$B))
k=length(levels(data$BLOQUE))
gl_i=i-1
gl_j=j-1
gl_b=k-1
gl_trat=gl_i*gl_j
gl_e=((gl_i+1)*(gl_j+1)-1)*((gl_b+1)-1)
gl_total=gl_i+gl_j+gl_b+gl_e+gl_trat
TC=(sum(data1)^2)/(i*j*k)
SCT=sum(data1^2)-TC
SCA=sum(sum(colSums(data1[1:3]))^2,sum(colSums(data1[4:6]))^2,sum(colSums(data1[7:9]))^2)/(j*k)-TC
SCB=sum(sum(colSums(data1[,c(1,4,7)]))^2,sum(colSums(data1[,c(2,5,8)]))^2,sum(colSums(data1[,c(3,6,9)]))^2)/(i*k)-TC
SCTRAT=(sum(colSums(data1)^2)/k) - TC -SCA-SCB
SCBLO=sum(rowSums(data1)^2)/(i*j)-TC
SCE=SCT-SCA-SCB-SCTRAT-SCBLO
CME = SCE/gl_e
result <- mvn(data = data1, univariateTest = "SW", desc = TRUE)
modelo <- aov(RENDIMIENTO~BLOQUE+A+B+A*B, data = data)
modeloT <- aov(RENDIMIENTO ~ BLOQUE+TRATAMIENTO,data=data)
anova <- summary(modelo)
```

# VERIFICACIÓN DE SUPUESTOS

 

I.  **Supuesto de Normalidad - Test de Shapiro Wilk**

    -   $H_{0}:$ La distribución de los datos no difiere de la normal

    <!-- -->

    -   $H_{1}:$ La distribución de los datos difiere de la normal

 

```{r,echo=FALSE,,fig.height=3.5}
result$univariateNormality

ggplot(data, aes(x = TRATAMIENTO,y= RENDIMIENTO)) + geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle ("Rendimiento de cebada en kg/ha en diferentes tratamientos")+ geom_boxplot(aes(fill=TRATAMIENTO)) + scale_x_discrete(labels = c("T1","T2", "T3", "T4", "T5", "T6", "T7","T8","T9")) + labs(x = "Tratamientos" , y = "Rendimiento en Kg ha-1" )+theme_bw() 
```

 

`Según el test de normalidad Shapiro Wilk, los valores de rendimiento en kg/ha para todos los tratamientos se distribuyen normalmente excepto el tratamiento 7 y 9, los cuales  presentan un valor atípico respectivamente`

\pagebreak

\pagebreak

II. **Supuesto de Homocedasticidad - Test de Levene**

    -   $H_{0}: \hat\sigma^2_{T1} = \hat\sigma^2_{T2} = \cdot \cdot \cdot = \hat\sigma^2_{T9}$\

    -   $H_{1}: \hat\sigma^2_{T1} \neq \hat\sigma^2_{T2} \neq \cdot \cdot \cdot \neq \hat\sigma^2_{T9}$

 

```{r,echo=FALSE}
leveneTest(data$RENDIMIENTO,data$TRATAMIENTO, center=median)
```

![Test de Levene - SPSS](levene.png){width="279"}

 

`De acuerdo al test de levene las varianzas del rendimiento en Kg./Ha. en los 9 tratamientos son estadísticamente iguales`

\pagebreak

# ANOVA DEL RENDIMIENTO EN Kg./Ha.

 

## Modelo Lineal Aditivo

$x_{ijk} = \mu + \alpha_i + \beta_j + (\alpha\beta)_{ij} + \delta_k + \xi_{ijk}$

$i = 1,2,3$\
$j = 1,2,3$\
$k = 1,2,3,4$  

## Suma de Cuadrados

 

-   $TC = \frac {x^2_{...}}{abr} = \frac {81^2}{3(3)4} = `r TC`$

-   $SCT = \sum x^2_{ijk} - TC = `r SCT`$

-   $SC_A = \sum \frac {x^2_{i..}}{br} - TC = `r SCA`$

-   $SC_B = \sum \frac {x^2_{.j.}}{ar} - TC = `r SCB`$

-   $SC_{AB} = ( \sum \frac {x^2_{ij.}}{r} - TC) - SC_A -SC_B = `r SCTRAT`$

-   $SC_{Bloq.} = \sum \frac {x^2_{..k}}{ab} - TC = `r SCBLO`$

 

## Hipótesis Estadísticas

### Factor A : Estiércol de ovino

1.  $H_0 : \alpha_i = 0 \\\ H_1 : \alpha_i \neq 0$
2.  Nivel de confianza $\alpha= 1\%; \ 5\%$
3.  $F_0 = 22.4263$
4.  $F_{5 \%}(2,24) = `r qf(p = 0.05,df1 = 2,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)` \\ F_{1 \%}(2,24) = `r qf(p = 0.01,df1 = 2,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)`$
5.  $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(2,24)$
6.  Dado que $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(2,24)$ se rechaza la $H_0$, por lo tanto existe diferencia altamente significativa $(p<1\%)$ entre el rendimiento promedio$(Kg./Ha.)$ de las 3 dosis de estiércol de ovino.

### Factor B : Roca Fosfórica de Sechura

1.  $H_0 : \beta_j = 0 \\\ H_1 : \beta_j \neq 0$
2.  Nivel de confianza $\alpha= 1\%; \ 5\%$
3.  $F_0 = 19.4991$
4.  $F_{5 \%}(2,24) = `r qf(p = 0.05,df1 = 2,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)` \\ F_{1 \%}(2,24) = `r qf(p = 0.01,df1 = 2,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)`$
5.  $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(2,24)$
6.  Dado que $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(2,24)$ se rechaza la $H_0$, por lo tanto existe diferencia altamente significativa $(p<1\%)$ entre el rendimiento promedio$(Kg./Ha.)$ de las 3 dosis de roca fosfórica.

### Interacción AxB : Estiércol de ovino x Roca Fosfórica

1.  $H_0 : (\alpha\beta)_{ij} = 0 \\\ H_1 : (\alpha\beta)_{ij} \neq 0$
2.  Nivel de confianza $\alpha= 1\%; \ 5\%$
3.  $F_0 = 5.0601$
4.  $F_{5 \%}(4,24) = `r qf(p = 0.05,df1 = 4,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)` \\ F_{1 \%}(4,24) = `r qf(p = 0.01,df1 = 4,df2 = 24,lower.tail = FALSE)`$
5.  $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(4,24)$
6.  Dado que $F_0 > F_{1 \%}(3,24)$ se rechaza la $H_0$, por lo tanto existe interacción $(p<1\%)$ y los factores no son independientes.

 

| $F.V$  |    $G.L$     |   $SC.$    |       $CM.$        |              $F_0$              | $Sig.$ |
|:------:|:------------:|:----------:|:------------------:|:-------------------------------:|:------:|
| Bloque |   `r gl_b`   | `r SCBLO`  |   `r SCBLO/gl_b`   |   `r (SCBLO*gl_e)/(SCE*gl_b)`   |        |
|   A    |   `r gl_i`   |  `r SCA`   |    `r SCA/gl_i`    |    `r (SCA*gl_e)/(SCE*gl_i)`    |  \*\*  |
|   B    |   `r gl_j`   |  `r SCB`   |    `r SCB/gl_j`    |    `r (SCB*gl_e)/(SCE*gl_j)`    |  \*\*  |
| $A*B$  | `r gl_trat`  | `r SCTRAT` | `r SCTRAT/gl_trat` | `r (SCTRAT*gl_e)/(SCE*gl_trat)` |  \*\*  |
| Error  |   `r gl_e`   |  `r SCE`   |    `r SCE/gl_e`    |                                 |        |
| Total  | `r gl_total` |  `r SCT`   |                    |                                 |        |

# COMPARACIONES MULTIPLES A PRIORI

 

## PARA FACTOR A : ESTIÉRCOL DE OVINO

 

$$
Totales =\left\{\begin{array}{ll}SC_{c} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} \\Q = \sum c_ix_{i..}\end{array}\right.
$$

 

| A : |    $A_1$    |    $A_2$    |    $A_3$    |
|:---:|:-----------:|:-----------:|:-----------:|
|     | $\mu_{1..}$ | $\mu_{2..}$ | $\mu_{3..}$ |

$C_1 = \mu_{1..} \ vs. \ (\mu_{2..} \ ; \ \mu_{3..})$ $\Rightarrow$ $C_1 = 2\mu_{1..} \ - \ \mu_{2..} \ - \ \mu_{3..}$

$C_2 = \mu_{2..} \ vs. \ \mu_{3..}$ $\Rightarrow$ $C_2 = \mu_{2..} \ - \ \mu_{3..}$

 

I.  HIPÓTESIS

    $H_{0}: c=0$

    $H_{1}: c \neq 0$

II. NIVEL DE SIGNIFICANCIA

    $\alpha=0.05$

    $\alpha=0.01$

III. VERIFICACIÓN DE ORTOGONALIDAD

     |          | $\mu_{1..}$ | $\mu_{2..}$ | $\mu_{3..}$ |
     |:--------:|:-----------:|:-----------:|:-----------:|
     |  $C_1$   |      2      |     -1      |     -1      |
     |  $C_2$   |      0      |      1      |     -1      |
     | $k_il_i$ |      0      |     -1      |      1      |

     $\sum \frac {k_il_i}{n} = 0$

     | $x_{i..}$ | 23.65 | 24.2 | 33.15 | $\sum C^2_{i}$ | $\sum c_ix_{i..}$ |         $SC_c$         |            $F_0$             | Sig. |
     |:---------:|:-----:|:----:|:-----:|:--------------:|-------------------|:----------------------:|:----------------------------:|:----:|
     |   $C_1$   |   2   |  -1  |  -1   |       6        | -10.05            | `r (-10.05)^2/(4*3*6)` | `r ((-10.05)^2/(4*3*6))/CME` | \*\* |
     |   $C_2$   |   0   |  1   |  -1   |       2        | -8.95             | `r (-8.95)^2/(4*3*2)`  | `r ((-8.95)^2/(4*3*2))/CME`  | \*\* |

     $SC_{C1} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {(-10.05)^2}{4(3)(6)} = `r (-10.05)^2/(4*3*6)`$

     $SC_{C2} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {(-8.95)^2}{4(3)(2)} = `r (-8.95)^2/(4*3*2)`$

     \pagebreak

IV. ESTADÍSTICO DE PRUEBA

    $F_{C1} = \frac {CM_{C_1}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r (-10.05)^2/(4*3*6)`}{`r CME`} = `r ((-10.05)^2/(4*3*6))/CME`$

    $F_{C_2} = \frac {CM_{C_2}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r (-8.95)^2/(4*3*2)`}{`r CME`} = `r ((-8.95)^2/(4*3*2))/CME`$

    Se comprueba que $SC_A = SC_{C_{1}} + SC_{C_{2}}$

    -   $SC_A=$ `r SCA`

    -   $SC_{C_{1}} + SC_{C_{2}} = `r (-10.05)^2/(4*3*6)` + `r (-8.95)^2/(4*3*2)` = `r (-10.05)^2/(4*3*6) + (-8.95)^2/(4*3*2)`$

V.  PUNTO CRÍTICO

    -   $F_t=`r round(qf(0.05,1,gl_e,lower.tail = F),4)`$ al $5\%$

    -   $F_t=`r round(qf(0.01,1,gl_e,lower.tail = F),4)`$ al $1\%$

VI. VALOR EXPERIMENTAL

    -   $F_{C_{1}} = `r ((-10.05)^2/(4*3*6))/CME`$

    -   $F_{C_{2}} = `r ((-8.95)^2/(4*3*2))/CME`$

VII. DECISIÓN

     -   Para el $C_1$ se rechaza la $H_0$ con un $99\%$ de confianza. Por lo tanto existe diferencia altamente significativa en el rendimiento de cebada $(Kg./Ha.)$ con dosis de estiercol de ovino de 4 y 8 $t/Ha.$. con respecto a ninguna dosis aplicada (Testigo).

     -   Para el $C_2$ se rechaza la $H_0$ con un $99\%$ de confianza. Por lo tanto existe diferencia altamente significativa en el rendimiento de cebada $(Kg./Ha.)$ con dosis de estiercol de ovino de 8 $t/Ha.$. con respecto a una dosis de 4 $t/Ha.$ .

\pagebreak

$C_1 = \mu_{1..} \ vs. \ (\mu_{2..} \ ; \ \mu_{3..})$ $\Rightarrow$ $C_1 = 2\mu_{1..} \ - \ \mu_{2..} \ - \ \mu_{3..}$

     |   $C_2$   |  -1  | -1  | -1  |  1  | 1    | 1    | 0     | 0     | 0     |       6        | 0.55              |  `r (0.55)^2/(4*6)`  |  `r ((0.55)^2/(4*6))/CME`  |  No  |

     $SC_{C1} = \frac {Q^2}{r \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {(18.45)^2}{4(18)} = `r (18.45)^2/(4*18)`$

     $SC_{C2} = \frac {Q^2}{r \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {(0.55)^2}{4(6)} = `r (0.55)^2/(4*6)`$

     \pagebreak

IV. ESTADÍSTICO DE PRUEBA

    $F_{C1} = \frac {CM_{C_1}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r (18.45)^2/(4*18)`}{`r CME`} = `r ((18.45)^2/(4*18))/CME`$

    $F_{C_2} = \frac {CM_{C_2}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r (0.55)^2/(4*6)`}{`r CME`} = `r ((0.55)^2/(4*6))/CME`$

    Se comprueba que $SC_A = SC_{C_{1}} + SC_{C_{2}}$

    -   $SC_A=$ `r SCA`

    -   $SC_{C_{1}} + SC_{C_{2}} = `r (18.45)^2/(4*18)` + `r (0.55)^2/(4*6)` = `r (18.45)^2/(4*18) + (0.55)^2/(4*6)`$

V.  PUNTO CRÍTICO

    -   $F_t=`r round(qf(0.05,4,gl_e,lower.tail = F),4)`$ al $5\%$

    -   $F_t=`r round(qf(0.01,4,gl_e,lower.tail = F),4)`$ al $1\%$

VI. VALOR EXPERIMENTAL

    -   $F_{C_{1}} = `r ((18.45)^2/(4*18))/CME`$

    -   $F_{C_{2}} = `r ((0.55)^2/(4*6))/CME`$

VII. DECISIÓN

     -   Para el $C_1$ se rechaza la $H_0$ con un $99\%$ de confianza. Por lo tanto existe diferencia altamente significativa en el rendimiento de cebada $(Kg./Ha.)$ en los tratamientos 7, 8 y 9 con respecto al resto de los tratamientos.

     -   Para el $C_2$ se acepta la $H_0$ con un $99\%$ de confianza. Por lo tanto no existe diferencia altamente significativa en el rendimiento de cebada $(Kg./Ha.)$ en los tratamientos 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 y 6 .

\pagebreak

$C_1 = (\mu_{31.} ; \mu_{32.} ; \mu_{33.}) \ vs. \ (\mu_{21.} ; \mu_{22.} ; \mu_{23.} ; \mu_{11.} ; \mu_{12.} ; \mu_{13.})$ $\Rightarrow$ $C_1 = 2\mu_{31.} + 2\mu_{32.} +  2\mu_{33.} - \mu_{21.} - \mu_{22.} - \mu_{23.} - \mu_{11.} - \mu_{12.} - \mu_{13.}$

![Contraste 1 - SPSS](AB/c1.png){width="357"}

 

$C_2 = (\mu_{21.} ; \mu_{22.} ; \mu_{23.}) \ vs. \ (\mu_{11.} ; \mu_{12.} ; \mu_{13.})$ $\Rightarrow$ $C_2 = \mu_{21.} + \mu_{22.} + \mu_{23.} - \mu_{11.} - \mu_{12.} - \mu_{13.}$

# ANÁLISIS DE TENDENCIA

# FACTOR A : DOSIS DE ESTIÉRCOL DE OVINO

 

$$
Totales =\left\{\begin{array}{ll}SC_{R(A)} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} \\Q = \sum c_ix_{i..}\end{array}\right.
$$

 

| $x_{i..}$  | `r sum(colSums(data1[1:3]))` | `r sum(colSums(data1[4:6]))` | `r sum(colSums(data1[7:9]))` | $\sum c^2_i$ | $\sum c_ix_{i..}$                                                                          | $SC_c$                                                                                               | $F_0$                                                                                                      | $Sig.$ |
|------------|------------------------------|------------------------------|------------------------------|--------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------|
| Lineal     | -1                           | 0                            | 1                            | 2            | `r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))`                            | `r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2)`                            | `r (sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2))/CME`                            | \*\*   |
| Cuadrático | 1                            | -2                           | 1                            | 6            | `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))` | `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6)` | `r (sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6))/CME` | \*\*   |

 

$SC_{A(Lineal)} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))`^2 }{`r k*j`(2)} =`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2)`$ $\Rightarrow$ $F_0 = \frac {CM_{A_{Lineal}}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2)`}{`r CME`} = `r (sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2))/CME`$

$SC_{A(Cuadra.)} = \frac {Q^2}{rb \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))`^2 }{`r k*j`(6)} =`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6)`$ $\Rightarrow$ $F_0 = \frac {CM_{A_{Cuadra.}}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6)`}{`r CME`} = `r (sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6))/CME`$

$\alpha=0.05 \rightarrow F_{5 \%}(1,24)= `r qf(0.05,1,gl_e,lower.tail=F)`$

$\alpha=0.01 \rightarrow F_{1 \%}(1,24) = `r qf(0.01,1,gl_e,lower.tail=F)`$

 

Se comprueba que $SC_A = SC_{A_{lineal}} + SC_{A_{Cuadra.}}$

-   $SC_A=$ `r SCA`

-   $SC_{A_{lineal}} + SC_{A_{Cuadra.}} = `r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2)`+`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6)` = `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*6)+sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))^2/(k*j*2)`$

| Cuadrático | 1                                 | -2                                | 1                                 | 6            | `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[1:3])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[4:6])),1*sum(colSums(data1[7:9])))` | `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6)` | `r (sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6))/CME` | No     |

 

$SC_{B(Lineal)} = \frac {Q^2}{ra \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))`^2 }{`r k*i`(2)} =`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*2)`$ $\Rightarrow$ $F_0 = \frac {CM_{B_{Lineal}}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*2)`}{`r CME`} = `r (sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*2))/CME`$

$SC_{B(Cuadra.)} = \frac {Q^2}{ra \sum c^2_{i}} = \frac {`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))`^2 }{`r k*i`(6)} =`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6)`$ $\Rightarrow$ $F_0 = \frac {CM_{B_{Cuadra.}}}{CM_E} = \frac {`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6)`}{`r CME`} = `r (sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6))/CME`$

$\alpha=0.05 \rightarrow F_{5 \%}(1,24)= `r qf(0.05,1,gl_e,lower.tail=F)`$

$\alpha=0.01 \rightarrow F_{1 \%}(1,24) = `r qf(0.01,1,gl_e,lower.tail=F)`$

 

Se comprueba que $SC_B = SC_{B_{lineal}} + SC_{B_{Cuadra.}}$

-   $SC_B=$ `r SCB`

-   $SC_{B_{lineal}} + SC_{B_{Cuadra.}} = `r sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*2)`+`r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6)` = `r sum(1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),-2*sum(colSums(data1[c(2,5,8)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*6)+sum(-1*sum(colSums(data1[c(1,4,7)])),1*sum(colSums(data1[c(3,6,9)])))^2/(k*i*2)`$

$SC_{A_{Cuad.}B_{Lin.}}=\frac {Q^2}{r (\sum c^2_{A})(\sum c^2_{B})}= \frac {`r (1)*(-1)*(4.75) + (1)*(1)*(11) + (-2)*(-1)*(7.6) + (-2)*(1)*(9.75) + (1)*(-1)*(10.75) + (1)*(1)*(11.85)`^2}{4(6)(2)}=`r ((1)*(-1)*(4.75) + (1)*(1)*(11) + (-2)*(-1)*(7.6) + (-2)*(1)*(9.75) + (1)*(-1)*(10.75) + (1)*(1)*(11.85))^2/(4*6*2)`$
